criteria: Analysis of Author's Use of Language
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of key terms within the text.
Student shows minimal understanding of key terms, with significant inaccuracies.
Student identifies key terms but struggles to define them accurately or provide context.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of key terms and their definitions within the text.
Student accurately defines key terms and explains their significance to the text.
Student demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of key terms, including nuances and contextual variations.
Student does not analyze how the author uses language or refines meaning.
Student attempts to analyze author's language but provides superficial or inaccurate observations.
Student identifies instances of author's language use but struggles to explain their effect on meaning.
Student provides a basic analysis of how the author uses language to shape meaning.
Student offers a detailed analysis of the author's language choices and their impact on the text's meaning.
Student demonstrates a nuanced understanding of how the author strategically uses and refines language to convey complex ideas.
Student is unable to apply their understanding of language to interpret the text.
Student struggles to connect their understanding of language to the overall meaning of the text.
Student makes limited connections between language analysis and the text's interpretation.
Student applies their understanding of language to interpret the text with some success.
Student effectively uses language analysis to support their interpretation of the text.
Student synthesizes their understanding of language and textual analysis to offer a insightful and well-supported interpretation of the text.
